result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Darrick L Guider

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Certification of transcript of proceedings of STATUS CONFERENCE commencing 08-13-2015 received and filed. (6 Pages.)
Copy of transcript forwarded to Ms. Dianne M. Erickson, 1429 North Prospect Avenue, Suite 211, Milwaukee, WI 53202 Public Defender Appointment.
This matter was previously dismissed but read in for purposes of sentencing and is following the defendant's other pending case for sentencing. No appearances made.

Defendant Darrick L Guider in court with attorney Allison Marie Ritter.  Defendant Darrick L Guider in custody.  Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for plea hearing. State placed negotiations on the record. Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered the case dismissed but read in for purposes of sentencing.  Calendar call scheduled for November 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Allison Marie Ritter in court, defendant Darrick L Guider not in court, in custody.  Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for status conference. Defense counsel waived defendant's appearance for purposes of this hearing. Parties have received the DNA results and are still in negotiations. Defense counsel requested a projected plea date. Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Plea hearing scheduled for September 29, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Court retained this matter post-rotation. Case transferred back to Branch 25. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.

Defendant Darrick L Guider in court with attorney Allison Marie Ritter.  Defendant Darrick L Guider in custody.  Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for motion hearing. Discussion regarding the State's joinder motion. Defense counsel does not oppose the motion. Court granted the State's motion for joinder with defendant's other pending case 15CF1290 for reasons stated on the record. Defense counsel may be filing a motion for severance from COUNT 3 of case 15CF2151. Parties are still waiting for the DNA results and request an adjourned status date. Court will retain this matter post-rotation. Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Status conference scheduled for August 13, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Order for Limited Contact Privileges signed and filed. Copies sent to ADA Thurston, attorney Ritter, and the Sheriff's Department. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.

Defense counsel requested a modification in the Court's order rescinding the defendant's communication privileges previously signed on 6/15/15. Court will allow the defendant to have telephone contact with his mother, Charlotte G. Defense counsel to provide the phone number of Charlotte G. to the Sheriff's Department. All other conditions of bail remain the same.

Defendant Darrick L Guider in court with attorney Allison Marie Ritter.  Defendant Darrick L Guider in custody.  Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case called to address the defendant's status of counsel in this case. In chambers discussion placed on the record. Court held colloquy with defendant. Attorney Ritter was privately retained in the defendant's other pending case 15CF1290 and the defendant wishes to have attorney Ritter represent him on this case. Defendant requested court appointed counsel and agreed to reimburse Milwaukee County for the expense. The court appointed Atty. Allison Ritter, present in court, to represent defendant in this matter at County expense and at the rate of $60.00 per hour. The court ordered the defendant repay the County at a rate of $50.00 per month beginning 08/01/2015, and then the 1st of each month there after. Court advised defendant failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. Signed, Distributed & Filed, Order Appointing Attorney at County Expense. Substitution of Counsel signed and filed. Case remains scheduled for motion hearing on 7/10/15. Case adjourned to Branch 25.

Court Order Rescinding Defendant's Telephone, Visitation, and U.S. Mail Custody Privileges signed and filed. Copy given to the State, defense counsel, and the Sheriff's Department. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
Arguments heard as to State's motion to rescind the defendant's communication privileges. Court granted the State's motion for reasons stated on the record. Order signed and filed.

Defendant Darrick L Guider in court with attorney Justin Singleton.  Defendant Darrick L Guider in custody.  Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for arraignment. Original Information was previously filed on 5/21/15. Defense counsel acknowledged receipt of the original information and waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Defense counsel's response to the State's joinder motion due on or before 6/22/15. Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Motion hearing scheduled for July 10, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Motion to Join Cases received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
Original PRELIMINARY HEARING Transcript (47 pages) commencing MAY 21, 2015, received and filed.  jm

Defendant Darrick L Guider in court with attorney Justin Singleton.  Defendant Darrick L Guider in custody.  Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Todd Armstrong-Milwaukee County District Attorney's Office Investigator.  Court took judicial notice of certified documents regarding case #F-943503 that are attached to the complaint.  
Case is temporarily passed.

Case is recalled.
Testimony of Todd Armstrong continues.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Case is reassigned to Judge Rothstein, Branch 25 due to lower pending case.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading.  Case is adjourned to Branch 25. Defense Counsel is requesting an Arraignment date.  Arraignment scheduled for June 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  
Defendant to have no contact with: SARA H(dob: 8/8/1984); her daughter DTH(dob: 3/30/2004); or the defendant's girlfriend, GLADY J.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Darrick L Guider in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Defendant Darrick L Guider in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dugan, Branch 10.  

Motion to dismiss COUNT 3 of the complaint by the defense, Argued  and DENIED by the Court.
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  
Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings. 
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.

Commissioner advised DNA has NOT been obtained from the Defendant. Court ordered the Milwaukee County  Sheriffs  Department to obtain DNA from the Defendant. Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wis. Stats. Section 165.77(4).
Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 21, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
